titles.title: Authorizing printing of the brochures entitled "How Our Laws Are Made" and "Our American Government", the pocket version of the United States Constitution, and the document-sized, annotated version of the United States Constitution.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.
Mr. Mica moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 221.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.
Amendment SP 2793 proposed by Senator Collins for Senator McConnell.
Amendment SP 2793 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate with an amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Boehner moved that the House suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendment.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on the motion.

vote.text: On motion that the House suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendment Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 11/19/1999--Passed Senate amended. Authorizes the printing of the following brochures as House documents: (1) an edition of "How Our Laws Are Made" and the 1999 revised edition of "Our American Government;" and (2) the 20th edition of the pocket version of the U.S. Constitution and its 1999 document-sized, annotated version.Authorizes the printing of the following books as Senate documents: (1) "Capitol Builder: The Shorthand Journals of Captain Montgomery C. Meigs, 1853-1861;" and (2) "The United States Capitol: A Chronicle of Construction, Design, and Politics."
